description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to vary condition 5 (sound insulation) of Planning Permission reference P092187 dated 13 April 2010 for the demolition of existing buildings and redevelopment of the site, move the position of Queensland Road (which involves stopping up the existing road) and develop one new building to the north and one to the south. The building to the south would be up to six storeys high (with photovoltaic) and provide 213 residential units and 345 sq.m of commercial space, with a mix of class A1 (shops), A2 (financial and professional services), A3 (restaurants and cafes), A4 (drinking establishments), B1 (business).  The building to the north would incorporate five towers providing 10 to 15 floors of residential accommodation above a plinth of mainly commercial space.  It would provide 516 residential units, 1,600 sq.m of sports centre for Arsenal Football Club and 1,330 sq.m of commercial space with a mix of class A1/A2/A3/A4/B1 as described above and 179 car parking spaces.
decision_conditions: The application has been approved following consideration of all the relevant policies in the Development Plan (Islington's Unitary Development Plan 2002 and the London Plan 2008), Government Planning Policy Guidance/Statements and other material considerations. It is concidered that the proposed variation would not result in undue loss of amenity for the future residents of the development. As such, the proposal is in accordance with policies 3A.6 and 4A.20 of the London Plan 2008 and policies Env17 and H7 of Islington's Unitary Development Plan 2002, which seeks to ensure a satisfactory standard of amenity in new housing development.
